item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There was never yet an uninteresting life. Such a thing is an impossibility. Inside of the dullest exterior there is a drama, a comedy, and a tragedy." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Dostoyevsky Fyodor
item.description: "You are told a lot about your education, but some beautiful, sacred memory, preserved since childhood, is perhaps the best education of all. If a man carries many such memories into life with him, he is saved for the rest of his days. And even if only one good memory is left in our hearts, it may also be the instrument of our salvation one day." -- Dostoyevsky Fyodor

item.title: Joshua add a quote by DH Lawrence
item.description: "The human being is a most curious creature. He thinks he has got one soul, and he has got dozens." -- DH Lawrence

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The right word may be effective, but no word was ever as effective as a rightly timed pause." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by DH Lawrence
item.description: "All that we know is nothing, we are merely crammed wastepaper baskets,unless we are in touch with that which laughs at all our knowing." -- DH Lawrence

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Life does not consist mainly, or even largely, of facts or happenings. It consist mainly of the storm of thoughts that is forever flowing through one's head." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Facts are stubborn things, but statistics are pliable." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow; there is no humor in heaven." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I don't see any use in having a uniform and arbitrary way of spelling words. We might as well make all clothes alike and cook all dishes alike. Sameness is tiresome; variety is pleasing." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "From this hour I ordain myself loos'd of limits and imaginary lines." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Whoever you are, now I place my hand upon you/ That you may be my poem/ I whisper with my lips close to your ear/ I have loved many women and men, but I love none better than you." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description:
"The road to wisdom is paved with excess.
The mark of a true writer is their ability to mystify the familiar and familiarize the strange." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "What we are doing to the forests of the world is but a mirror reflection of what we are doing to ourselves and to one another." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn" -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Joshua add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "If we surrendered to earth's intelligence we could rise up rooted, like trees. " -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once there was a tree, and she loved a little boy." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "You are a child of the universe, no less than the trees and the stars; you have a right to be here. And whether or not it is clear to you, no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Joshua add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Joshua add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "The tree which moves some to tears of joy is in the eyes of others only a green thing that stands in the way. Some see nature all ridicule and deformity... and some scarce see nature at all. But to the eyes of the man of imagination, nature is imagination itself." -- William Blake

item.title: Joshua add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Be curious, not judgmental." -- Walt Whitman
